Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/dina-update-for-asia-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2020-08/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Jenmana, Moshrif and Yang (2020), "Regional DINA Update for Asia"; [/URL_TEXT][/URL][URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2021-dina-regional-update-for-asia-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-6/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Bajard, F. and Moshrif, R. (2021), "2021 Regional DINA Update for Asia"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.

Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1996: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1997-2001: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2002: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2003-2004: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2005: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2006-2007: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2008: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2009-2011: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2012: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2013: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2014-2019: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2020: extrapolated distribution + imputed nonresponse, 2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1988, 1995, 2011. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1988, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 1988, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]; For long run series (full population), [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/longrunpaper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, L., Piketty, T. “Global Income Inequality 1820-2020: The Persistence and Mutation of Extreme Inequality” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL][URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/historical-inequality-series-on-wid-world-updates-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2023-01/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT] ; Chancel, L., Moshrif, R., Piketty, T., Xuereb, S., (2023),  "Historical Inequality Series on WID.world - Updates"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 2000, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.

The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 2003, 2011, 2015, 2018. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 2003, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1980-1984: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1985: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1986-1990: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1991: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1992-2003: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2004-2005: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2006: survey + imputed nonresponse, 2007: interpolated survey + imputed nonresponse, 2008-2019: survey + imputed nonresponse, 2020: extrapolated distribution + imputed nonresponse, 2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1994, 1998, 2003, 2009, 2014, 2018. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1994, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1992, 2008. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1992, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 2004, 2014. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 2004, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1983: survey + concept correction + tax data, 1984-1985: survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1986-1988: survey + concept correction + tax data, 1989: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1990: survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1991-1996: interpolated survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1997: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1998: survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1999-2008: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 2009-2013: survey + tax data, 2014-2019: extrapolated distribution using survey data, 2020-2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1990: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1991-1995: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1996: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1997-2003: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2004-2019: survey + imputed nonresponse, 2020: extrapolated distribution + imputed nonresponse, 2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022); Before 1990, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty (2021). “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world”[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 2004, 2012. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 2004, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: WID.world aggregations of individual country data
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/update-of-global-income-inequality-estimates-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2020-11/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, L., Moshrif, R. (2020) “Update of global income inequality estimates on WID.world”[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Revisiting the Latin American Exception; [/URL_TEXT][/URL]; Before 2001, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty (2021), "Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1990, 1995, 1999, 2004, 2008, 2010, 2012, 2015, 2017. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1990, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 1990, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL][URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/historical-inequality-series-on-wid-world-updates-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2023-01/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT] ; Chancel, L., Moshrif, R., Piketty, T., Xuereb, S., (2023),  "Historical Inequality Series on WID.world - Updates"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Inequality series are imputed by taking the average income shares of Middle African countries.
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Inequality series are imputed by assuming that income shares are the same as in Ethiopia.
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1988: survey + concept correction + tax data, 1989-1991: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1992-1993: survey + concept correction + tax data, 1994-1995: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1996-2002: survey + concept correction + tax data, 2003-2019: survey + tax data, 2020: extrapolated distribution + tax data, 2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1981, 1995, 1999, 2004, 2010, 2015. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1981, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 1981, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 2005, 2017. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 2005, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 1987, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1980: extrapolated distribution + tax data, 1981: survey + concept correction + tax data, 1982-1987: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1988: survey + concept correction + tax data, 1989-1993: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1994-2001: survey + concept correction + tax data, 2002: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 2003-2005: survey + concept correction + tax data, 2006-2018: survey + tax data, 2019: extrapolated distribution using survey data, 2020-2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1991, 1994, 2002, 2007, 2012, 2018. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1991, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Fiscal income rescaled to match the macroeconomic aggregates.
Sources: WID.world computations using fiscal and net national income.

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults

Methodological Notes: 1922-1950: tax data from Indian Tax Department; 1950-2014: Tax data from Indian Tax Department and Survey data from NSS0, using IHDS to convert survey consumption into survey income (see Chancel Piketty 2019 for details). After 2014, values are extrapolated assuming inequality neutral growth rates. The World Inequality Lab is currently updating 2015-2021 estimates using newly released tax data. This information will be uploaded online shortly.

WID.world Working Paper 2017/15; [/URL_TEXT][/URL][URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-the-middle-east-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-05/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by El-hariri and Moshrif, “2022 Regional DINA update for the Middle East”; [/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/alvaredoassouadpiketty-middleeast-widworldwp201715/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Facundo Alvaredo, Lydia Assouad and Thomas Piketty (2017). Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults

Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1992, 1994, 1997, 2005, 2015. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1992, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 1992, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1988: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1989-1992: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1993: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1994: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1995-2000: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2001: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2002-2005: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2006-2019: survey + imputed nonresponse, 2020: extrapolated distribution + imputed nonresponse, 2021: extrapolated distribution

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1986, 1994, 2002, 2017. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1986, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 1986, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

(2021), “Regional DINA update for Middle East”[/URL_TEXT][/URL][URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/historical-inequality-series-on-wid-world-updates-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2023-01/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT] ; Chancel, L., Moshrif, R., Piketty, T., Xuereb, S., (2023),  "Historical Inequality Series on WID.world - Updates"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: WID.world aggregations of individual country data

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1980, 1993, 1997, 1999, 2001, 2005, 2010, 2012. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1980, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 1980, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 2006-2013: survey + imputed nonresponse, 2014-2019: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2020: extrapolated distribution + imputed nonresponse, 2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1987, 1993, 1995, 2000, 2004, 2008, 2014. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1987, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: WID.world aggregations of individual country data
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2021-dina-regional-update-for-middle-east-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-4/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Bajard, F., Moshrif, R. (2021), “Regional DINA update for Middle East”[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults

The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Fiscal income rescaled to match the macroeconomic aggregates.
Sources: WID.world computations using fiscal and net national income.

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1984, 1990, 1998, 2000, 2006, 2013. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1984, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 1984, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]https://wid.world/document/dina-update-for-asia-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2020-08/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Jenmana, Moshrif and Yang (2020), "Regional DINA Update for Asia"; [/URL_TEXT][/URL][URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2021-dina-regional-update-for-asia-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-6/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Bajard, F. and Moshrif, R. (2021), "2021 Regional DINA Update for Asia"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 2003, 2009, 2015. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 2003, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 2003, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1981: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1982: interpolated survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1983: survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1984: interpolated survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1985: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1986: interpolated survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1987: survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1988: interpolated survey + concept correction + interpolated tax data, 1989: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1990-2001: survey + concept correction + tax data, 2002-2003: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 2004-2014: survey + tax data, 2015-2019: extrapolated distribution using survey data, 2020-2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty (2021), "Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1992, 1994, 2005, 2007, 2011, 2014, 2018. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1992, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1983-1988: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1989: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1990: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1991-1994: interpolated concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1995-1997: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1998: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1999-2002: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2003-2009: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2010-2018: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2019-2020: extrapolated distribution + imputed nonresponse, 2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1983-1988: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1989: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1990: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1991-1994: interpolated concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1995-1997: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1998: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1999-2002: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2003-2009: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2010-2018: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2019-2020: extrapolated distribution + imputed nonresponse, 2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Sources: [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty (2021), "Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1989-2006: survey + concept correction + extrapolated nonresponse, 2007-2013: survey + extrapolated nonresponse, 2014: interpolated survey + tax data, 2015: interpolated survey + extrapolated nonresponse, 2016-2019: survey + extrapolated nonresponse, 2020: extrapolated distribution + extrapolated nonresponse, 2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1984, 2000, 2005, 2010, 2013, 2016. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1984, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Towards Distributional National Accounts in Africa (1990-2017); [/URL_TEXT][/URL];[URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/2022-dina-regional-update-for-africa-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2022-06/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Updated by Robilliard (2022), "2022 DINA Regional Update for Africa"[/URL_TEXT][/URL]Before 1984, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wordpress.wid.world/document/countries-with-regional-income-imputations-on-wid-world-world-inequality-lab-technical-note-2021-15/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel and Piketty, “Countries with Regional Income Imputations on WID.world” (2021)[/URL_TEXT][/URL]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the tax unit defined by national fiscal administrations to measure personal income taxes.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 1991, 1994, 2001, 2005, 2011, 2018. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 1991, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities? Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1980-1981: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1982-1984: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1985: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1986-1987: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1988: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1989-1990: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1991-1993: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1994-1995: interpolated survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 1996-2003: survey + concept correction + imputed nonresponse, 2004: survey + imputed nonresponse, 2005-2006: interpolated survey + imputed nonresponse, 2007-2019: survey + imputed nonresponse, 2020: extrapolated distribution + imputed nonresponse, 2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. equal-split adults
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Pre-tax national income  is the sum of all pre-tax personal income flows accruing to the owners of the production factors, labor and capital, before taking into account the operation of the tax/transfer system, but after taking into account the operation of pension system. The central difference between personal factor income and pre-tax income is the treatment of pensions, which are counted on a contribution basis by factor income and on a distribution basis by pre-tax income. The population is comprised of individuals over age 20. The base unit is the individual (rather than the household) but resources are split equally within couples.
Technical description: Pre-tax national income =Pre-tax labor income [total pre-tax income ranking]+Pre-tax capital income [total pre-tax income ranking]
Methodological Notes: Summary of data construction by year (see source for details): 1991-1992: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 1993-2001: survey + concept correction + tax data, 2002-2003: interpolated survey + concept correction + tax data, 2004-2012: survey + tax data, 2013-2019: extrapolated distribution using survey data, 2020-2021: extrapolated distribution
Sources: Blanchet, Chancel and Gethin (2020), “Why is Europe less Unequal than the US?” + Updates by Neef and Sodano (2022)

Variable name: Pre-tax national income. Share Adults. tax unit
Intuitive description: Pre-tax national income share held by the p99p100 group. Methodological Notes: Figures are obtained by correcting survey tabulations provided by the World Bank (PovcalNet) to account for conceptual discrepancies and the underrepresentation of top incomes. Surveys are available for the following years: 2017. Income shares are interpolated linearly when surveys are available at the beginning and at the end of a given period. Inequality series are extrapolated backwards to 1990 and forwards to 2019 by keeping income shares constant when no data is available for these years.
Sources: After 2017, [URL][URL_LINK]http://wid.world/document/cgm2019-full-paper/[/URL_LINK][URL_TEXT]Chancel, Cogneau, Gethin & Myczkowski (2019), How large are African Inequalities?
